info.title: Subscriptions API (v3)
info.description:
VTEX Subscriptions REST API Documentation

This documentation describes the available REST APIs for VTEX Subscription System.

With Subscriptions you can set up regularly scheduled deliveries.

All requests need authorization (VTEX Id authentication token or VTEX Appkey and Apptoken headers)

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description: Retrieve a specific cycle by its ID.

parameters.name: cycleId
parameters.description: ID from the desired cycle.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description: List cycles filtering by some arguments.

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: Lower limit for the date of creation of the cycle

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Upper limit for the date of creation of the cycle

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Id from the subscription that generated the cycle

parameters.name: customerEmail
parameters.description: Customer that owns the subscription. Defaults to the current logged user

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Current cycle status

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page used for pagination

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size used for pagination

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

isUsingV3.title: isUsingV3
isUsingV3.description: Indicates whether or not Subscriptions V3 is enabled.

onMigrationProcess.title: onMigrationProcess
onMigrationProcess.description: Indicates whether or not the account is in the migration process to Subscriptions V3.

executionHourInUtc.title: executionHourInUtc
executionHourInUtc.description: Indicates the time future subscription orders will be generated.

items.description: Type of delivery channel. The values that are possible are: `pickup-in-point` for pickup point and `delivery` for regular delivery.

randomIdGeneration.title: randomIdGeneration
randomIdGeneration.description: Defines whether or not the subscription order IDs will be randomly generated.

isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnCreation.title: isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnCreation
isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnCreation.description: Defines whether or not multiple installments are enabled when a subscription is created.

isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnUpdate.title: isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnUpdate
isMultipleInstallmentsEnabledOnUpdate.description: Defines whether or not multiple installments are enabled when a subscription is updated.

orderCustomDataAppId.title: orderCustomDataAppId
orderCustomDataAppId.description: When filled, this field passes along the `customData` infomration in the order to the future recurrent subscription orders.

postponeExpiration.title: postponeExpiration
postponeExpiration.description: Defines whether or not the expiration of subscriptions can be postponed.

manualPriceAllowed.title: manualPriceAllowed
manualPriceAllowed.description: When set to `true`, this property enables manual price configuration in subscription items. This is valid for all existing subscriptions, provided that there is a manual price configured and that `isUsingV3` is `true`.

useItemPriceFromOriginalOrder.title: useItemPriceFromOriginalOrder
useItemPriceFromOriginalOrder.description: When set to `true`, this property enables using the manual price for each item from the original subscription order. This is only valid for new subscriptions, created from the moment this configuration is enabled. For this to work, it is mandatory that the `manualPriceAllowed` property is set to `true` and that `isUsingV3` is `true`.
